definition: letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random

sentences.english: I'm sure we will twelve-step our way out of the difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 我坚信我们会一步步摆脱困境的。

sentences.english: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams. ---E. Roosevelt.
sentences.chinese: 未来属于那些坚信他们梦中之美的人们。

sentences.english: For her part, she insists touch-screens will soon be owned by everyone.
sentences.chinese: 对于她来说，她坚信触摸屏会很快普及。

sentences.english: But are you convinced of it?
sentences.chinese: 但是，你对此坚信不移吗？

sentences.english: This, I believe, is the key to living a happy life.
sentences.chinese: 这，就是我所坚信的，打开生活中快乐之门的钥匙。

sentences.english: We accommodate differences of students, adapt our work to meet individual needs and group differences.
sentences.chinese: 我们坚信有教无类，以配合学生个体需要和群体差异。

sentences.english: And he believes in risking dramatic action in a crisis.
sentences.chinese: 他也坚信危机中极具风险的民主行动。

sentences.english: If they firmly believe one-child policy, there will be more and more the dink.
sentences.chinese: 如果他们坚信独生子女政策，将会有越来越多的丁克。

sentences.english: Hoffman believes that genius is, in a word, nontransferable.
sentences.chinese: 霍夫曼坚信，天赋是不可传递的。

sentences.english: I see no reason why medical research cannot go ahead.
sentences.chinese: 我坚信医药学研究一定会继续向前。

sentences.english: You should write what you believe in.
sentences.chinese: 你应该写些自己坚信的东西。

sentences.english: Our security is assured by our perseverance and by our sure belief in the success of liberty.
sentences.chinese: 对自由的坚信不移和坚忍不拔是我们安全的保证。

sentences.english: Some point is very clear, the Sri Lankan to the buddha's tooth believed that does not move.
sentences.chinese: 有一点很清楚，斯里兰卡人对佛牙坚信不移。

sentences.english: I renew my love for you, trusting in your guiding hand.
sentences.chinese: 我重申对你的爱，坚信袮的引导。

sentences.english: I am a firm believer that classroom management is your key to success in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 我坚信课堂管理是课堂教学成功的关键。

definition: to be convinced/to be sure/to firmly believe/to be positive that/definite news
to believe firmly/devout in one's faith
to persevere unremittingly (idiom); to keep going until the end
to persevere with/to persist in/to insist on
